inn1.comm: short and wide outside off stump and it carries through nicely to Thomas. Strauss is relieved to flag one through early
good carry again here outside off, closer to Strauss this time as he left alone
back of a length on off stump this time, slowly raises through to Strauss who places  a bat in the way
for dot balls in a row as Strauss lets another one go
full for the first time today, Roach has a very good yorker, pushed with a toe-end to mid-off
and the over ends as it begun, with Strauss leaving alone. Good start for West Indies then
tossed up around off stump, Prior eases into defence
hint of turn already and Prior is cagey in defence again, England are pinned down already
ooh, this finds an edge as Prior tries to drive, squirts to point
runs! Finally it's runs. Four of them. The outfield is quicker than Roach! Prior leant into a fluid drive and once it beat cover it was always four
good recovery from Benn, just did Prior in the flight a touch and he lunged forward to block
another careful, tentative prod to finish the over. So just one scoring shot in 12 deliveries
that's very close to cut but Strauss is strong on the shot. Unfortunately for him he remains on 0 after picking out point
close! Nervy moment for Strauss as he is rushed on a pull shot, trying to break the shackles but got it high on the bat and spooned it just over a backpedalling square leg
precious run again, more certain than the last, as Prior clips to midwicket where Benn fields and makes a hash of the relay through by dropping the ball
finally a more certain shot for Strauss as he glances into space
Roach is wearing his fastest wheels here, already touching 90mph. Good length and off-stump line and Prior stands tall to block
fuller to finish, Prior is hanging back expecting another shot one. Pats to cover. Decent pace and carry in the pitch so far
slip and a leg slip for Benn. Finds turn here back into Strauss who defends
carefully swept down to deep square to give Prior the strike
touch of spin here again and Prior leans forward to defend
nicely done from Prior, leaning back and getting the fraction of width outside off he thrives on. Threaded wide of point and it sped to the rope
firmly pushed back towards the bowler, Benn gets down 26ft to field
too short from Benn and it allows Prior to cut again, more careful shot this time and earns him a couple. Good over for England, they needed it
Roach is generating plenty from his whippy action and it's rushing Strauss in defence
fuller and the drive is woefully timed and dribbles to mid-off
Strauss is just trying to manufacture something here, giving himself a touch of room to drive. But at the moment Roach's pace is rushing him
ah, Strauss gets all of this! Half-volley length and banished wide of cover
Roach pulls back his length and Strauss can only defend as a result
stylish drive but bashed straight to mid-off
Prior has shown good composure so far, not trying to overhit anything. Pushes down to long-off
Strauss hurtles down the wicket, steady as drunk, shaping to hack before pushing a nervy defence
neatly done by Prior once more, leaning forward to drive a fullish ball down the ground
that's the first one that really has spun, surprised Prior who poked at it suspiciously
full toss is punished! Carefully again but that makes it a decent start for England. Clipped around the corner and Benn looks unimpressed
driven down the ground to finish a good over for England. Prior going well but this pitch, so far at least, looks very good for batting
back of length but the line is just leg-sided enough for Prior to nurdle a single to fine leg
on the pads to Strauss, which Miller reckons is a no-go area, but Strauss picks out square leg
very nicely done here from the England captain. Couple of steps down the track and, as Miller would tell you, Strauss is violent off his pad, flicking to the midwicket boundary
again Roach ventures near the pads but Strauss picks out midwicket
heave and miss outside off! Strauss leant back and aimed something expansive, but only at thin air
after all that heaving Strauss is back to compact mode, flicking  an off-stump delivery wide of midwicket
ooh nervous start from the bowler, touch short and some width too but Strauss can't time his cut shot
short again and Strauss wants a tilt at Russell I reckon, wheeling a pull shot to deep midwicket
yup, Strauss definitely wants a bit of this. Dancing down the wicket again to try and thwack this through the off side. Doesn't time it remotely
my my, Russell is not impressed and bangs in a sharp bouncer that has Strauss ducking in a hurry. Follows the delivery with a stare
no no, short is not the place for Strauss. He gets all of this pull shot and it speeds to the fine leg rope
another short one, Russell needs to find a way to calm into this contest, Strauss powers another pull shot but the sweeper tides up on the leg-side boundary
steady start from Sammy, that's what he's  all about and Strauss has no pace to work with
short to Strauss at Sammy's pace won't end well for the bowler. Leans back and eases his arms through the ball, pings over the midwicket boundary and into the fence. Top shot!
good change of pace in response, much slower, but fuller too and Strauss can't connect
another cutter and Strauss, despite flicking his wrists at the ball, can't force it away
width combined with no slip means Strauss can happily guide this through the vacant area for a gimme single
sharp single to finish the over, Prior clipped to mid-on and immediately hared off for one. But for the one short ball that was a good over from Sammy, sadly the short one went for six

Russell strikes! Emphatically! Full and sliding into Prior is exactly the place to bowl to him. He was hanging on the back foot and the ball had  burst through and splattered middle stump before he'd even thought about defence
looks a good start but yeesh, lucky he hit this! Full and picked off the pads, would have been a huge lbw appeal had he missed but as it was Trott is away in a hurry
this is a better delivery, around off stump and Trott pops forward to defend
too short and Trott, the much maligned Trott, has his second boundary. Up on one leg and flipping a pull shot behind a square for four
much fuller and squeezed away in defence
ah, coos throughout the Cricinfo desk here as Trott languidly leans into an off drive. Barely touched it but it raced away
around the wicket, tucked into the leg side
hint of width and he cuts it away through point but there's a sweeper on the cover boundary
back of a length, opens the face and guides to third man
too much on leg stump, neatly flicked away to deep square
wide outside off this time, Trott places it between cover and backward point for his fourth boundary
and another, this time he comes onto the front foot and drives a half volley through the covers. Superb stuff from Trott, but West Indies have lost their lines
now Strauss drives strongly through the covers but it goes straight to the sweeper
drifting towards the pads and, yep, that's another boundary for the flying Trott as he whips it elegantly through midwicket
that's better, banged in back of a length and Trott goes onto the back foot to defend
more runs through the leg side, but this time it's just a single to deep square

gone! Russell strikes again, the short ball gets Strauss. He went for the pull but got a top edge and Gayle make excellent ground running back from midwicket, taking the catch over his shoulder then holding on as he hit the deck
another one comes off the middle of Trott's bat although finds mid-off
on leg stump, worked backward of square on the leg side
tossed up and worked down to long on
onto the front foot, drives down to long off this time
pushed towards leg stump which allows an easy tuck into the leg side
opens the face into the off side, well judged single by the Warwickshire team-mates
on the back foot, pushed into the covers and this single is a little tighter but a fumble makes it comfortable
full on off stump, Trott comes forward and drives to mid-on
another lovely drive from Trott, down the on side but Bishoo makes a good diving save at mid-on to keep them to a single
full outside off, defended back to the bowler
banged in short, Bell rocks back and pulls it with a roll of the wrists to long leg
everything is finding the middle from Trott, another on drive and again Bishoo in action at mid-on
full outside, driven firmly to Gayle at short cover
now he brings out the reverse and gets it fine through third man...top batting from Trott
smart stuff, follows the boundary with a gentle nudge down to long on
on off stump, pushed into the off side
driven to short cover
quicker ball, touch shorter and Bell forces into the off side
on the back foot and driven down the ground
starts short outside off, chopped away and Pollard shows some great hang time at backward point
premeditated sweep, Bell misses and is taken on the pad but outside off
tucked out to midwicket
down for the sweep again and manages to get it to deep square
on leg stump, turned away through midwicket
another sweep from about off stump and finds deep square again
back of a length, dropped into the leg side
worked out to midwicket
waits on the back foot and pushes down to long on
fuller outside off, Trott drives but finds mid-off
opens the face and guides down to third man
pushed along the ground to midwicket...tight start from Pollard
very full and dug out back to the bowler
some gentle turn, Trott pushes down the ground off the back foot to take England to their 100
jumps away to leg which opens up the off side and he punches out to deep cover
nicely bowled, tossed up on middle and finds some turn to take the edge to short third man
whipped down to long on
again, some slow turn but a touch short on this occasion which gives Bell time to place it out to deep cover
back of a length, Bell plays to the leg side
width outside off and it's driven out to deep point
angled towards Trott's pads and he flicks it through midwicket
waits for this and opens the face to find third man
nearly a run out as it's played to midwicket...Sammy throws to the bowler's end and the keeper, Thomas, was desperate for it
cut away square on the off side...England dealing in singles at the moment
goes down very early, he was paddling that come what may, and gets it very fine...Sarwan is also slow in the deep
turn from off stump, but the pitch is slow and Bell adjusts
driven past the non-striker, Bishoo gets in a tangle with Trott as he tries to field off his own bowling
dropped in short, Trott onto the back foot and pulls gently through midwicket
short and turns outside off but Bell can only slap it to cover
nearly done! Excellent googly and Bell is nearly bowled as he tries to cut but gets it to backward point
Pollard slips in a shorter ball that Trott tried to steer to point
this time Trott does pick off a single
scream of "diiiiive" from behind the stumps, but despite the dive, Bell collects a single to long-on
with a straight and upright bat, Trott picks up a single down to long-on
poor line gifts Bell his first boundary. Overpitched on leg stump and Bell flicked his wrists at it and it raced to the rope at fine leg
well, this is dropped down the leg side I think. Shoved down the leg side and Bell got a faint edge. Thomas couldn't hold on
more good work from Bishoo and Trott defends
Gayle moves swiftly to field. Which is no small matter
touch of flight and some turn beats an enquiring outside edge
Trott gets down on one knee and tickles this around the corner
Sammy slams the turf in disgust after missing his stop at cover to gift a single

Bishoo strikes! His first wicket in ODI cricket. What a soft end to a fantastic innings. Started with a bang and ended in a whimper, chipping the ball gently to midwicket. Good reward for Bishoo, his spell changed the run of play
Bell stands tall and calmly defends
Bell tries to give himself some room but Pollard is a wily competitor and the change of length means Bell can only punch down the ground
back of a length and Morgan stands tall to block
ooh, bit of a nothing fiddle sort of shot attempted and it beats the outside edge
this just sticks in the pitch a touch which made Morgan's wristy flip around the corner rather risky
goodness, Gayle has flung himself across the turf to field. Moved so swiftly! Maybe he just wanted a quick lie down
Morgan eases a single down the ground. Sammy has set the field deep so it's a help-yourself shot
poor delivery, probably his worst of the day, shot and wide but Bell's dragged a pull shot from outside off just for a single
another single for Morgan knocked around the corner
plenty of air on this which meant Bell, who had got down on one knee very early, had to wait a long time to dab around the corner
ooh, Morgan on the reverse-whack very early, the extra spin defeated him though and it spun into his pad
wow, this really does turn, from a shortish length admittedly but always good to see a legspinner. Rashid, oh Rashid. Anyway, Morgan helps it on its way to fine leg
Pollard has barely bowled a full ball this innings, Morgan sits on the back foot here and chops some width to deep cover
short again, outside off again, would have been a wide if Bell left it, as it was he reached for it and toe-ended a single to deep cover
Morgan exchanges singles with Bell by dabbing to third man
Bell missed out here, with third man up in the circle the width and length was easy to dab for four but Bell picked out the fielder. Rightly, he is very annoyed with himself
fuller, finally fuller. Bell taps back down the ground
Pollard is unimpressed as this is given wide. It was short and outside off, Bell aimed a cut but couldn't reach it. First extra of the match that
another Bell dot ball as he prods to cover
touch short to Morgan, the sort of Steve Smith-like delivery Morgan was pulling to midwicket in Australia. No alarms this time though as he picks off a single
ooh, touch of spin here beats a tentative defensive prod
again Bell is slightly indecisive in defence
ooh, Bell is down the track and outside leg, trying to make something happen here but he can't
finally Bell rotates the strike, finding a gap at cover. Pressure is definitely building on him
Morgan gets forward and defence with textbook conventionality

haha, maybe not that much pace! Off stump is on its way to England! Fullish ball angling in, Bell was hanging back and the off stump was sent flying! England's campaign is tottering now, starts for all the England players but they're four down for not enough now. Ravi Bopara has a huge job to do. Can he prove his talent under pressure?
ooh, Bopara is rushed here as well. Makes it seem like it didn't bounce as much as he expected. Luke Wright is in next! Cripes
more solidly behind this from Bopara. Leaning forward to block. Looks nervous at the moment though
more more decisive movement from Bopara into this. Stepping forward into a drive as Roach persists with a full length
full from Roach again, just too wide of off stump to interest Bopara
ooh, huge appeal here as Bopara is trapped in front. Will there be a review?... No. Perhaps a faint inside edge saved Bopara here. He was late getting forward and yes, big inside edge saved him
looks like a slider or something here, definitely not a legspinner and Morgan defends
oh no, that could be it! Bishoo has the key wicket! Tame end too, Morgan aiming a delicate reverse sweep, misses and brushes a glove through to Thomas who makes no mistake
tossed up from Bishoo, finds some spin too and Wright very tentatively forward prods a defence
wow! Spin and real bounce, looks very dangerous! Wright groped forward but it leapt past him
Bishoo is landing grenades all of a sudden. Wright is making it look tough! This again spits off a length up to the gloves
ooh, slashed in very Wright fashion to deep cover. Looked desperate but at least one of the England batsmen are off the mark. What an over from Bishoo! Long live legspin!
wristspin one end, pace from the other. This is quality viewing! Wright hurries into a defence at off stump
Wright sees a foot of width and aims an expansive slash. It was through him in a flash
prodded away in defence. I wouldn't say it was solid but at least the bat was straight. Zipping through from Roach
good-looking drive but the way England are going at the moment there looks about 20 fielders out there
no ball! Sweet relief for England. Wright managed to squeeze a single out to point so Bopara has the free hit to try and get himself off the mark

ooh, sign of things to come later in the innings perhaps. Roach spears in a reverse-swinging yorker that Bopara can get the slightest bit on inside edge on. Almost runs himself out but he's off the mark
solid defence from Wright. You can't say that too often. Another excellent West Indies over
good air from Bishoo, daring Bopara to do something expansive. Instead it's carefully defended
more languid here from Bopara leaning to drive to cover
clipped around the corner and Thomas, who is as loud as he is quick, hares off in pursuit
Wright aims an old-fashioned slog-sweep, connects nicely for a single to deep midwicket
Bopara looks the faintest bit more confident now as he defends another big-spinning delivery
very short but Bopara can't time his cut shot
on off stump, pushed into the off side
comes back into Wright who plays to the off side
he'd have been gone with a direct hit! Wright chops into the off side, Gayle collects at cover, turns and throws at the non-striker's end. Batsman was well short
defended on the back foot
pushed down the ground, mid-off is quite deep and it's an easy single
banged in very short and called wide for height
oh dear, that's a shocker...fired down the leg side and beats the keeper
much better, back of a length and cramps Wright for room as he pushes into the off side
round the wicket, dragged a little short but Wright picks out backward point
fuller at middle and leg, pushed into the off side
tossed up nicely, Wright onto the front foot and pushes into the covers
onto the back foot and placed wide of backward point
on off stump, defended into the off side
good line, nothing on offer for Wright as he defends
tight on off stump, Bopara tries to work into the leg side but can't get it away
gone! And another. England falling in a heap. Bopara gets an inside into the stumps as he plays with an angled bat. Stumps are shattered for third time today
edged! But falls short of Gayle at slip as he opens the face and almost guides the ball
beaten outside off as the ball angles across the left hander
on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
banged in short and it's over Tredwell's head so won't be a maiden
full outside off and left alone
full and driven down to long off
on off stump, worked to midwicket
drifts onto leg stump, tucked past short fine-leg
pushed back to the bowler
plenty of turn outside off as Tredwell shoulders arms
worked into the leg side
back of a length, defended to the off side
my goodness, a boundary! Offered some width and Wright frees his arms to drive in the air over backward point
forced square along the ground this time out to the cover sweeper
width to the left hander on this occasion and Tredwell punches nicely through point to get off the mark
back of a length on leg stump, worked out to the deep
well, that was odd...Russell appeared to lose his run up but continued to deliver. Wright left a full ball outside off, the indicated he wasn't sure what happened. Anyway, it's over
outside off, defended to the off side
defended again
quick ball down the leg side as Tredwell misses a sweep
full outside off and left alone
fired down the leg side again and this time the keeper misses it as well
worked from outside down to long on
round the wicket, driven with a straight bat down to long on
onto the front foot and defends...useful over for England because of the wides
edged away down to third man as Wright drives hard at a full delivery
round the wicket, angled away down to third man
shot! Power and placement from Wright (yes, honest) as he drills a half volley through the covers
plays and misses as he cuts, beaten by some extra bounce
worked into the leg side and midwicket is quickly on it
defended back to the bowler
worked down the ground again, taken from outside off stump
driven nicely through the covers and the sweeper has to run around to keep them to a couple
hint of turn as Wright comes onto the front foot and plays to the off side
full this time and Wright drives it down to long on fairly firmly
clever batting as Tredwell picks up another run into the square-leg area
pushed square into the off side and another well taken run
on the back foot, worked off the hip through square leg and it's also placed nicely
on off stump, pushed into the off side
worked into the leg side and can't beat midwicket
tight on off stump, pushed back down the pitch
down the leg side, whipped away by Wright straight to fine leg
round the wicket, Tredwell opens the face but finds backward point...however, they get a bonus two runs as the throw shoots past the keeper out towards the leg-side boundary. Sloppy.
begins by dropping in short, Wright latches on and cracks it away over midwicket...not a good start for the captain

gone! Well that was a shambles. Wright cut hard to backward point where Pollard made a fine stop. Both batsmen were caught ball-watching in mid-pitch, Wright continued to run to the non-striker's end which left Tredwell stranded
off the mark straight away as he tucks this into midwicket
down the leg side, takes the pad towards square leg and Thomas scampers after it
tucked off the pads down to fine leg
another short ball is pulled to deep square...an ordinary over but it produced a wicket
double whirl from Pollard but only to dish up some leg-side nonsense that Wright clips a couple from
fuller and straighter, Wright pushes to cover
enough width here for Wright to slash at. And to be fair to him, he times it reasonably
200 up as Bresnan nudges a single into the leg side
touch wide here and Wright slams it down the ground with a fair bit of timing again
Bresnan, for all his heft, is actually quite a conventional player and straight-bats this down the ground
skids on and Bresnan jabs a bat down in a hurry
more air on this and spins a touch, homing in on outside edge
good lengths and lines again, touch of spin too and Bresnan leans forward to prod to leg
ah, dragged down very shot and it sat up asking for trouble. Trouble came in the shape of a Luke Wright pull shot and he powered it to the midwicket rope. That's the first boundary off Bishoo
and another! Wright is on fire! Too short again and Wright was deep into his crease, heaving this down the ground for four
shortish once more and Wright cuts hard to keep the strike out to deep point. England matches don't end without a thrill and Wright is nudging them up to something competitive here
banged in short and it flies over Wright, who ducked more out of courtesy than necessity
oops, shoved down the leg side and but for an excellent take on the half-volley from Thomas could have been five
full and crashed to mid-off
back of a length and Wright aimed a leg-side swish, too quick on him so couldn't time it
oh Bresnan missed out there. Thigh-high full toss but he could only pat it to midwicket
excellent delivery this time. On off stump and offering to slide in, solid defence
Roach slips this past the inside edge and it thuds off the pads
slipped in quicker and flatter, Bresnan squeezed it out to long-off
another gift missed out on as a shin-high full toss down the leg side is guided to the fielder
nicely done from Bishoo, just held it back a fraction and had Wright groping forward in defence
ah that ends a sparky innings from Wright. Not a great shot, slogging to the deep midwicket fielder but without his contribution England would be nowhere in this game
fired in quickly again to Bresnan who can only jab  back to the bowler
driven off the toe-end back to Bishoo to end a superb spell from him. 3-34 on debut with the wickets of Trott, Morgan and then Wright is a fine, fine effort. His introduction changed the match
Swann carefully keeps out his first delivery. Fired in full in search of swing by Roach
Roach is again venturing full and this time Swann finds a single wide of point
overcooks the yorker this time but at 147mph this is plenty quick and Bresnan pushes a single down the ground
that'll do nicely, in theory. Free hit as Roach oversteps

for the second time in the innings the free hit almost brings a run out and just about brings a single. It was a yorker squeezed out to point, the batsmen got half-way through a run, before standing aimlessly in the middle of the pitch. Direct hit was curtains
yorker attempted and dug out towards mid-on
somehow Bresnan got his groove on and sped through for a single, the shy at the stumps missed, which helped his cause
fired in quick around off stump and Bresnan's toe-end cut dribbles away to point
Swann this time picks off a single, pushing down the ground
good work from Benn, no width on offer and Bresnan can only prod a defence
full toss but Bresnan is too conventional to muscle this away, instead he straight-bats to mid-off
poked towards midwicket, just  a single

good beans from Swann, backing himself to land this. Comes down the track, gives himself room, makes it into a full toss that he drives all along the ground wide of cover for four. Not a great spell for Benn that 0-60
Bresnan this time tries to give himself room, gets the full toss he wants but can't beat mid-off
high full toss, Bresnan thought it was above waist-height, it wasn't and he swing at fresh air brought nothing until the keeper fumbled
Swann enjoys a full length and times this to deep midwicket
edge! Precious edge for England. Full toss that Bresnan aims to heave at, kisses the edge and with third man up it was always four
Roach's gameplan is simple, aim a yorker, Bresnan jumps leg side to try and power through cover but can't do it
four more! It's that edge again! Roach is rapid and the thick edge hurtles past the keeper for four. England just finding a way to stay afloat in this tournament

have to give credit to captain and bowler, backed the wicket-taker and he's struck emphatically. Swann's stumps are a mess, full and straight, Swann jumped leg side to swish a drive but it was through him

full and straight again but Tremlett somehow manages to pat down the ground. Hmm, not sure what to make of that. Russell pretended to pull out the delivery just before reaching the crease, before straightening up and landing his yorker. Trying to sell Tremlett a dummy. Smart thinking or against the infamous 'spirit of the game'?
Bresnan looks like he really powers this, but the timing it so bad that it trickles away
good lines and length from Russell, he's done superbly this over. Tremlett very cagey in defence
again Tremlett is very cautious, standing perfectly still to prod a defence
excellent over ends with Tremlett keeping the strike- pushing a single to mid-off
banged in very short and this gets right up to Tremlett's ears, which is no bad effort
that'll do nicely for England. Prodded to midwicket, Tremlett took a long time to get motoring but got through
Roach hasn't quite landed the yorkers perfectly, but he hasn't been far off and Bresnan's attempted drive dribbles to cover. A misfield allows a single, suspect West Indies won't mind that
that'll be all. Good finish from Roach, banging in a short ball that gets Tremlett into a tangle, fends off with a glove that loops behind to Thomas to take

inn2.comm: ooh, hint of movement back into Smith who plays off the back foot to point
nicely driven off the back foot, cover gets a hand on it which means mid-off can come round and keep them to a single
good line, back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
driven off the back foot into the off side...the fielders are deep so Gayle can just jog through
hint of width and Smith cuts it down to third man...was in the air but nowhere near a fielder
here we go! Gayle down the pitch but then misses with his attempted heave through the leg side
round the wicket, on off stump, defended to the covers
drifts onto leg stump and worked into a gap at square leg
nicely bowled, but Swann is annoyed as a single is given away to cover with Gayle just dropping the ball and setting off
touch too full and Smith whips it away through midwicket
wow, that's a ripper! Turn and huge bounce from outside off, Smith jerks his bat out of the line
on off stump, comes forward and defends to cover
down the leg side, poor ball especially with fine leg up and it's whipped away off the hip by Gayle
on leg stump, nicely timed off the pads but it's straighter through midwicket this time
on the charge! Gayle comes down the pitch and clubs this back over Bresnan's head straight down the ground
banged in short and it goes across Gayle who leaves it alone
through the off side this time, full and wide from Bresnan and Gayle leans on the drive...it's not all brute force
and another, this one flies off the edge down to third man as Gayle charges again...wasn't as convincing but a good result for West Indies
round the wicket, straightens a touch on middle and it's defended
wrong line down the leg side, clips the pad and races towards fine leg
on off stump, comes forward and defends
pushed down the leg side
that's nice, turn and extra bounce on off stump as Smith defends
too straight, Smith works it off the back foot out to deep square
powerful drive down to long off
starts on leg stump and he's lucky to get away with it as Gayle clips straight to short fine-leg
splays his front out of the way then heaves through the leg side. Not timed but it reaches the boundary...Gayle can barely run
down the pitch again, latches onto this one cleanly and sends it miles over mid-on...mighty blow. Who needs running?
and another, gives himself a touch of room to the leg side and lofts this straight down the ground...once bounce for four
switches to round the wicket but it doesn't work, back of a length again and Gayle dismissively swings it over midwicket
finally goes full at the stumps, comes out as a low full toss and is bunted straight to cover
turned off leg stump to short fine-leg
on middle and off, defended to the off side
angled towards leg stump, turned through midwicket and a limping Gayle is able to complete a second
defended with bat and pad together
onto the back foot and works it through square leg...Smith playing the perfect role alongside Gayle
drifting in towards off and Gayle offers respect in the form of a defensive push into the covers
starts full and squeezed to midwicket
touch short, allows Smith to work it off the back foot
on middle and off, defended to the on side
now he brings out a slog sweep, picks it up from off stump and sends it whistle flat over midwicket

gone! Has Tredwell done it? Gayle given lbw but he's reviewed it. No bat, this looks good. And the decision stays. Massive breakthrough for England. Gayle played forward and was struck below the knee roll. Replays said it was clipping the top of the stumps
more turn, Sammy comes onto the front foot and defends
angling down the leg side
worked into the leg side
nicely bowled on off stump, comes forward and defends
tossed up and driven back to the bowler
driven into the packed off side field
angled towards leg stump, Smith comes forward and there's half a shout...nowhere near, but an excellent maiden
more turn, takes an inside edge as Sammy comes forward but no short leg
lunges forward again, takes the pad
that's how to do it! Takes a stride down the pitch and a free swing of the arms lofts it handsomely over midwicket
quicker from Tredwell, outside off and Sammy defends...another inside edge towards the short leg area
full outside off this time and driven through the covers, good running from this pair

Is this another? Yes it is, Smith has been smartly stumped. Fired it quite full, it got in a tangle of bat and boot, the ball dribbles back to Prior who takes the bails off. The replay is good, but more drama. The third umpire presses the wrong button first! It's quickly changed and he's given out.
goes over the top straight away, great response from Sammy who drives on the up and clears mid-off
dropped in short and pulled away through midwicket this time, not quite timed and deep square can get around
that's rubbish from Bresnan, wide outside off and it allows Sammy a free swing of the arms...another boundary through the off side
splices a pull but it falls into space on the leg side
that's better from Bresnan, on middle and off to the left hander...defended into the covers
defended to backward point
wow, Sammy barely seemed to get much of this but it flew. Whipped the bottom hand through the ball and it whistled into the crowds over long-on
rare moment of calm here as Sammy prods into the leg side
nicely done from Tredwell, arm ball, slid past the outside edge
this one is the offspinner that turns a touch, only into the middle of Sammy's bat and he hurries a single to mid-off
touch of flight and Bravo is more conventional so carefully defends. He can bat orthodoxly while his partners blaze
again careful but secure defence to end the over
back of a length to Sammy who swings hard at it without finding dreamy timing
flash and a miss outside off stump. Probably deserved to be smacked for four but it bounced over Bravo's cut
Tremlett lands his first full ball of the innings and Bravo pops it back to him in defence
good delivery here, fullish and heading for off stump. Carefully pushed to mid-off
oof, take that! Just back of a length, Bravo leant back and whipped a pull shot that rocketed through midwicket for four
flash outside off finds an edge that flies catchable height through a vacant gully area
definite spin again for Tredwell and has Bravo groping for it outside off
Tredwell starts slightly straighter and Bravo blocks respectfully
driven hard but straight to mid-off
forward defence, but the flashing backlift makes it exciting
again the high backlift comes down in defence

Tredwell has three, England are scrapping. Tredwell could be an England matchwinner!? Fancy that! Bravo leant forward to defend, enough turn kissed the outside edge and crept through to Strauss who stayed low to scoop it inches off the turf
much better from Tremlett, hammering down a short ball that skips past a ducking Sammy
good delivery once more, short and has Sammy hopping. But that's his short-ball quota for the over done so we know what's coming
haha, Thomas might well have denied his captain a boundary here! It was a half-volley that Sammy thwacked straight back into his team-mate's boot

slower ball is misdirected, bobbling down the leg side. Prior fumbles his take and the ball dribbles towards the helmet. It would have been five runs if it hit and Sammy is jumping up and down with excitement!
much better length and line, full outside off and Sammy, in a rare moment of calm, prods a single
slip in place for Thomas and Tremlett finds an outside edge but it's a thick one and dribbles wide of point
Sammy keeps the strike by working this around the corner. It's Tredwell of bust for England it seems!
Tredwell floats one up in Sammy's half and he swings his big arms through the line and sends it sailing into the crowds! Such a simple game
quicker ball is a good response and Sammy clunks down a defensive prod
ooh, this sticks in the pitch a touch and Sammy scoops it past the bowler
good work from Tredwell here, tossing it up outside off, generating spin and Thomas defends to leg
Sammy wants a single but there isn't one here as Thomas defends to the off side
wow, maybe this is why he's been promoted! Thomas stretches across to the off side and whips his wrists at the ball, pings off the bat, wide of long-on and races away for four. What placement!
bustling start on a length, Sammy gets deep into his crease and shoves it down the ground
despite a big dive, Morgan can't cut it off at short midwicket so Thomas has a single
not a great delivery here, short and wide, crashed out to deep point
this time Morgan does collect as Thomas flicks to leg
touch of indrift here finds an inside  edge as Thomas aims a drive
punched to point to end what's been an oddly quiet over
Tredwell around the wicket to Sammy, who leans forward to defend
this would have been a wide if Sammy didn't help it to fine leg
big turn here, touch of bounce too and Thomas taps it to midwicket
the spin here takes it down the leg side for a wide
little bit too short and wide, allows Thomas to punch a drive through cover
short again, sat up asking for trouble, Sammy banged it hard but to deep cover
good ball to end the over, forcing quiet defence outside off. Reckon with these two right handers in that might be Tredwell's spell

another one falls, this game is brewing into another classic! Sammy's slogging finally gets the better of him but what a little cameo that's been! It was outside off, just kept a little low, found the inside edge and dragged onto the stumps
finally Sarwan is in, good steadying influence I reckon, gets an inside edge here back to Bopara
Sarwan tries to squeeze a cut shot away  but there is no room for it
ooh, Bopara slides in an indrifting yorker that Sarwan digs out at the final moment
neatly steered past a diving point
back of a length and Thomas defends carefully. The required run rate is a doddle but after Pollard what is there?
ooh, dragged this far wide of the stumps as Sarwan aims an expansive cut
very nicely done from Thomas, cutting with a straighter bat wide of third man to scoot back for two
that's the place to bowl it for Bresnan. Length to Thomas is fine. Blocked
once more Bresnan finds those infamous 'good areas' and there is nowhere for Thomas to go
overpitched and with some swing heading down the leg side, flicked off an inside edge into the leg side
solid and sturdy defence to a good ball. How absurdly conventional
that will do nicely for Bopara, on a length around off stump and Thomas punches to mid-off with the straightest of blades
Thomas picks out mid-on this time with a back-foot punch
fuller this time, straighter too. Driven back to the bowler who skips across to field

Bopara has done it again! It's that inside edge again! Poor shot really but the pressure paid. Just aimed to glide it down to third man but the inside edge shoved it onto the stumps. Don't take your eyes off England! Here comes Pollard, and it's still a Powerplay!
full and straight from Bopara, good nerve there. If he showed it when he batted England wouldn't be scrapping. Pollard puts his enormous blade into line
huge appeal from Bopara to finish a wicket maiden over. Just struck Pollard outside the line though
on off stump, plays back and defends
angling towards the pads, flicked out to midwicket
back of a length outside off and defended to cover
stays deep in the crease and defends
jags back into Sarwan who plays it down into the leg side
good line, fuller on off stump and Sarwan is solidly behind it...tidy maiden from Bresnan but run rate isn't an issue
well bowled, hint of movement which squares up Pollard and finds a leading edge into the covers
tight stuff, on middle and off, not much bounce and Pollard is almost caught on the back foot
late movement into Pollard, chops it down towards third man...there's appeal for lbw as they feel it's pad before bat. They consider a review but decide not to bother. Hit outside off.
whipped off middle stump to midwicket
touch short and it's driven to backward point
tries to bring out a thumping drive but completely mistimes it and the ball bounces back towards Bopara...another maiden, three in a row
good line on off stump, Sarwan plays into the off side
a little too straight and it allows a single to midwicket...the first run in 21 deliveries
goes for the yorker but it's well play as Pollard whips it along the ground through midwicket
good bouncer, rises past Pollard's chest as he drops his hands
there he goes, that's Pollard as he clubs a good length over mid-on...England have a few words to the batsman who chirps back. Great stuff.
good comeback from Bresnan, full on off stump and it's worked into the leg side
full at the stumps, driven out to cover
there's that dangerous shot, trying to guide it down to third man but he safely finds backward point rather than the stumps
on off stump, defended into the covers
chopped away into the off side and bounces to backward point
full again and driven straight to mid-off
rare loose ball from Bopara and it's cut away through backward point...just dragged it a little too short and wide
ooh, turn and Pollard is taken on pads as he plays back
didn't take long, no ground is big enough to stop him, and he launches this from off stump high over midwicket
shorter, flatter and neatly turned out to deep square-leg

dropped! Ravi has missed it, is that the crucial moment? Pollard went for a huge swing over the leg side, got a leading edge high into the off side. Bopara turned and chased but couldn't take it over his shoulder
worked into the leg side
defended back to the bowler
drilled towards mid-off who is fairly deep...not without good reason
worked off the stumps into the leg side...Sarwan runs hard but it stays at one
nearly a run out! Pushed into the off side, Pollard sets off but there was never a run and he has to quickly turn to get back
worked into the leg side
opens the face to backward point
dismissive from Pollard...a straight thump down the ground, nothing more
worked out to midwicket
pushed towards the pads and that's an easy pick-off to deep square
blimey, nearly another! Pollard goes for the pull and almost bottom-edges into the stumps
big appeal from Wright as he takes Pollard on the pads but it's going down
big appeal again...almost identical to ball before as Pollard tries to work to leg
tucked off the stumps down towards long leg who is very wide and it means a couple
outside off, pushed to Swann
touch short and Sarwan waits on the back foot then places it out to deep cover
well bowled, tossed up but didn't turn as much...Pollard defends off the back foot
gone! Swann has done it. Pollard goes lbw. He played back and was beaten by the turn. He was given out on the field but reviewed it. Replays showed it was clipping leg comfortably
onto the front foot and defends
solid behind that as it turns and he defends with bat and pad together
good straight delivery which Sarwan defends
takes the pad into the leg side
back of a length, opens the face to point
flicked neatly out to deep midwicket
solidly behind the line to defend into the off side
defended square to point
outside off and left alone
ooh, that turns and finds the inside edge but goes along the ground to short leg
comes forward and defends to the off side
pushed down to long on
more turn and this one only lands a little in front short leg after taking the edge
connects well with this sweeps, flies away square but Tredwell makes good ground to save the boundary
Wright skids one in quickly for Sarwan to shuffle a defence
Sarwan's calmness could be pivotal here. Stands tall to punch a drive to deep cover
good lengths from Wright again, he's been impressive in both departments. Oddly
ooh, that bottom-edge drag-on almost proved fatal again, poor shot really. Bounced over Prior and bobbled of for one
ah serene stuff from Sarwan. So easy, driving through the line to bring up West Indies' first boundary in six overs
nudges a single into the leg side to keep the strike. At this stage England were 149-5
starts shortish, but the line at least is good and Sarwan turns a single to midwicket
shortish once more from Tremlett and Russell stands tall to drop a defence by his feet
this is a touch fuller from Tremlett, searching for the top of off. Russell defends comfortably
how about that! Tremlett on a length always ends violently. Russell just leant back, swung across the line and clubbed it miles!
he's confident after that blow and wristily flicks out to deep square. Very unhappy returns for him

poor delivery, full and speared down the leg side. Russell suddenly looks a proper batsman and clipped around the corner to send it skimming to the fine leg boundary. The match swinging back in West Indies' favour now
Sarwan remains quietly assured, clipping around the corner
Russell swishes a pull shot and he's apparently a schoolboy champion 100m runner, so beating him on the second is unlikely
Wright straightens up his line and Russell is respectful and convention in defence
what a day Russell is having! Tailender he is not! This is a creaming drive, punched high and wide of mid-off. He's still holding the pose as it crashes into the boundary boards
West Indies must be favourites now, squeezes off the outside edge to deep point
very conventional drive finds cover
good start here, finds a fullish length and it just nips away a touch. Tremlett appealed but it was actually edged onto pad
won't be any swing from there. But at least for Tremlett it's not a boundary. Short and rising to Sarwan who defends easily
fuller this time and driven back towards Tremlett. Who fields before crumpling over for no good reason
another good delivery heading for off stump is steered to point. Russell is through for the single in a flash
ooh, almost more damage for Tremlett as Russell swatted a short ball powerfully towards the midwicket rope

Russell expansive again but didn't get all of this, aimed to try and smash it over midwicket but the lack of timing sent it one-bounce to the fielder on the boundary. Russell looks in mighty fine order, could be a matchwinner unless England strike soon. Time for Swann surely?
won't find out yet because Sarwan is solid and quiet in defence
touch of spin here from outside off, nothing to trouble Sarwan though
short enough for Sarwan to land a cut shot, chopping down to deep point to steal a couple. He's played so well today
good cricket from Sarwan, blocking to long-on. That brings Russell on strike. Gets a word of advice from Sarwan
very calm and careful block to cover and Russell has a single in a hurry
Sarwan wanted a single here as he clipped to midwicket. Russell just slipped so it prevented a single
oops, starts with a filthy full toss. Luckily for the bowler the swatted-sweep finds deep square
with a flick of the wrists Sarwan sends the around the corner to fine leg. Much as they want it, the batsmen can't find two
short leg in for Russell as well now. Quicker ball is blocked carefully
good nerve from Russell, steering this quicker ball down to third man
Sarwan stretches across to the off side to prod this to leg very safely
tossed up a touch and Swann is rewarded with turn and bounce but soft hands prevented problems
Tredwell lands a good length and line but Russell is secure in defence
punched back to the bowler carefully
what a shot that is! This deserves to be a matchwinning innings, inside-out cover drive against the spin. Flew to to the boundary flat, and all the way!
ah, first really silly shot from him. Just hacked at it and it dribbled off the bottom edge
carefully and securely pushed back towards the bowler
well, but for the one astounding shot that was a good over
good flight and line outside off, Russell is confidently forward in defence

Swann has done it!? Has he? This is mighty close! Russell aimed a huge swipe out to long-on, Trott backpedalled to hold an excellent catch on the boundary rope, but as he tumbled Trott might just have touched the rope. Six or out!? England's World Cup depends on this. No clear angle on it. Could be a shadow? Trott claimed it, this is so difficult to tell. SIX GIVEN. That could be it!
full toss here is driven firmly, but straight to cover
since that shot Russell is quieter, carefully and studiously behind it
another very careful dot ball pushed to midwicket. What a moment that was
swept confidently away to deep square. England look dejected now
nothing for him here, on a length and down the leg side. Bobbled off a pad around the corner
Sarwan has played such a steady hand throughout this tension-filled chase
this time he nudges a single around the corner
Bresnan finds the edge but it flies down to third man, definite spring has gone from England
Sarwan again is ice-cool, flipping this around the corner to change the strike back to Russell
good delivery, full and straight, but Russell's bat is equally straight in defence
steady from him, tossing up around off stump. Russell solid in defence
ooh, beaten outside off stump. Russell aims a cut but it slips past him
this is flicked off the pads to deep square, takes Russell one way from fifty
cool and careful defence to a fullish ball
driven firmly but straight to cover
no need for Sarwan to rush and he prods a defence
starts well with a hint a movement back into Russell who defends
opens the face and backward point makes a good save
worked out to midwicket
takes the pad, half an appeal from Bopara, dribbles down to third man
turned out to midwicket
so close! Somehow Sarwan gets this very fine down to third man, it looked as though he took it right off the stumps
round the wicket, on off stump and defedned
gone! Tredwell strikes and there are no reviews left. Tredwell was round the wicket, Russell played played back and was given lbw, he doesn't look pleased but he can only walk off for 49

not given lbw, England review this time. Benn propping forward. What a moment. Inside edge is first question...it's mighty close. We are still waiting for the pitch map. Umpire wants to check the edge again. And after all that it's umpire's call on height. Just clipping the bails.
lunges forward and defends again...bat this time
half a stride and defended, but not with confidence
nicely bowled on middle and off, defended to the off side
pushed into the off side
driven firmly back to the bowler
forced off the back foot into the covers
nicely whipped down to deep square-leg...two balls for Benn to survive
gee, finds the inside edge which cannons into the pads and away from the stumps
full at the stumps, driven down to mid-off

gone! Would you believe it. Swann has struck. Extra bounce, Sarwan went to turn it on the leg side and gets an inside onto the thigh pad which loops gently to Ian Bell at short leg. You couldn't write these scripts
pushes into the off side
gone! And another! He tries to go down the ground, but doesn't connect and lofts it towards mid-off where Tremlett makes good ground to his right and takes a smart, low catch
pushed into the off side
tossed up on the stumps, driven towards cover who is quite deep and allows a single
round the wicket, leans forward and defends down just in front of Bopara at silly point
takes the pad out to midwicket
pushed firmly down the pitch, Bopara dives in his follow through and gets a hand on it
driven firmly but straight to mid-off and too hard for a single

gone! England have done it. A run out to win the match. It was a wide ball, Benn got a bottom edge down which scoot down to fine leg...Trott was quickly in and picked it, then hurled it back to Prior with a brilliant throw. That allowed Prior to demolish the stumps and England are still alive at this World Cup. Breathless. Bonkers. But brilliant fun to watch.
